{{Wireless embedded system |brand=node |model=Node Explorer |revision=V3.5 |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=07/21/2006 |manuf_country=United Kingdom |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability=mostly UK |type=location-aware media player |fcc_id=LUB-80211GCF |ic_id= |pwr_v= |pwr_amp= |pwr_conn= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=AMD |cpu1_model=Alchemy Au1200 |cpu1_cspeed=400 |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=32 |fla1_brand=Spansion |fla1_model=S29GL256P10TFI02 |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4T51163QE-ZCD5 |ram1_num=2 |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=SD Card |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=Socket Go Wi-Fi! P500 |wi1_module_if=CompactFlash |wi1_chip1_brand= |wi1_chip1_model= |wi1_chip2_brand=Airoha |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none=true |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed= |lan_ports= |wan_ports= |flags=screen,battery,audio out (3.5mm),GPS |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} [http://web.archive.org/web/20070110012022/http://www.nodeexplore.com/hardware_nodeexplorer.shtml Product page (via archive.org)] :Wi-Fi capability is [http://web.archive.org/web/20050803013209/http://www.nodeexplore.com/hardware_nodeexplorer.shtml initially noted as 802.11bg], downgraded to 802.11b in [http://web.archive.org/web/20061213151052/http://www.nodeexplore.com/hardware_nodeexplorer.shtml later product pages] :320x240 TFT QVGA screen :Upgradeable SD Card (1GB default, upgradeable to 4GB) :Linux based :8 hour battery life, 3 hour recharging cycle
This device is a ''location-aware'' media player thing. It seems to have been marketed towards usage as a tour guide device.
[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_qkYWztNXyM ''Node Explorer Portable GPS Teardown'' on '''YouTube'''] :'''AMD''' Alchemy Au1200 based (AU1200-400MGD, 400MHz) ([http://www.linux-mips.org/wiki/Alchemy '''Alchemy''' on linux-mips.org]) :GPS module appears to be a [http://www.falcom.de/uploads/media/JP13_LPX_family_hardware_manual_ver_1.04.pdf '''Falcom''' JP13-S-LP] ::GSC3e/LP (low-power '''SiRFstarIII''') based :w/ '''Sharp''' LZ9FC22B LCD controller :[http://www.datasheetcatalog.org/datasheet/philips/UCB1400BE.pdf '''NXP''' UCB1400BE Audio codec with touch screen controller and power management monitor] :2x 2200mAh 3.7V Li-ion batteries (label indicates '''VARTA Microbattery GmbH''' manufacture, made in Korea) :"LQ035Q7DH03 6Y001206" is on LCD label and is presumably its P/N :Manuf. 01/2008
Wireless modules used in this device ''may'' differ..
[http://gadgetshow.channel5.com/gadget-show/videos/other/node-explorer Used in the London Zoo at some point] :[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0rnQIzJA9Xw Video on ''The Gadget Show''] .. perhaps the [http://web.archive.org/web/20041108043031/http://www.nodeexplore.com/pdfs/Node_HarbourTrail_020904.pdf Harbour Trail (w/ the '''Bristol Ferry Boat Company''')] :''Node worked exclusively with Hewlett Packard Research Labs to develop a unique software solution.'' ... maybe the [http://web.archive.org/web/20041108042008/http://www.nodeexplore.com/pdfs/Node_BrunelWalk_020904.pdf Brunel Walk (again w/ the '''Bristol Ferry Boat Company''')] .... probably some [http://web.archive.org/web/20060114091846/http://www.nodeexplore.com/pressreleases/NodeAntennaPR_180705.pdf museums (licensed via '''Antenna Audio''')]
[http://web.archive.org/web/20041108042858/http://www.nodeexplore.com/pdfs/NodeExplorer_v2_020904.pdf PDF w/ info for v2 of the '''Node Explorer''']
